class_notes:
Same as CPLT 751R 6
This seminar takes one of the most understated painting genres, still life painting, as a point of departure to rethink the stakes of ecocriticism in the Anthropocene present. The objective is to try out a different narrative, where ecocriticism is not necessarily a nostalgic return to the world after decades of formalism and myopia literary and visual studies, but a militant turn to description and the arts of describing that could find its impetus in the work of Svetlana Alpers, Louis Marin, Roland Barthes, Norman Bryson, Daniel Arasse, Jacques Ranci√®re, Paul de Man, Victor Stoichita, and Eve Sedgwick among others. In English.
